text: <@U0ZR63HLK|adc> has joined the channel
just to make everybody know :slightly_smiling_face: sorry for not reviewing anything but I am on sick leave :S
feel better!
get better <@U1AU8DRQR> .  we'll need you back in good shape
Just a quick check on merge policy, we need two +2s to merge, then can any maintainer submit? Or should someone not involved in the +2-ing do so?
current practice seems to be the second person to +2 a change merges it most frequently, but that is merely an observation of mine
Great, thanks <@U0UHG4VP1>
<@U1AU8DRQR> GWS!
<@U0XPR4NP4> usually the second +2 should push the submit but I have observed that sometimes people don’t and so I go in and clean-up occasionally
technically, we just need the second +2
Great, thanks, I had seen changesets with two +2's and no merge, so just wanted to make sure it was okay for the second +2 to merge
<@U0ULK2JPP> here:
so, one thought I had is that: I have projects that are built on the current architecture…in fact, something between v0.5 and v0.6 releases
i have a few patches in master that make master more interesting to me rather than v0.6 moving forward over the next few months
(while 1.0 stablizes
it would be nice to somehow preserve the current state of master as a bridge of “newer than v0.6.1”   but more mature than convergence/1.0
so my question is: does anyone care?
if so, one thing we could do is merge the current master to v0.6 and cut v0.6.2 from those changes
alternatively, we could make a “v0.7” branch from master
or, we say screw it and convergence gets folded into master and we are just looking forward
thoughts?
i have a feeling that, if for whatever reason, the notion of preserving whats in master was rejected, ill end up doing it on my own as a one off
which is less desirable, but doable
`alternatively, we could make a “v0.7” branch from master` - if I read that right, you are really saying `freeze master before the big merge`
I prefer “branch” rather than “freeze”, heh, but yes
right
:slightly_smiling_face:
I love that
i am fine if that is “v0.6.2” rather than a distinct branch
it gives something to compare to
as you and I know, branches are a PITA :wink:
on the other hand, there’s the argument that 0.6 is close enough to master
why one more 0.7 to confuse
yes, theres very little difference really…they are close
i want to pick up the new baseimage pipeline for my upcoming work, that is my primary motivation
(that was not in v0.6)
perhaps we can call it master-before-convergence or something in stead of 0.7 ?
just as a historical artefact… ?
your thoughts ?
I’m leaning towards not cutting another branch….
0.6 and master …. that’s it
(basically I talked myself out of another branch I guess :slightly_smiling_face: )
yeah, i really dont want to maintain another branch
i was kind of hoping the v0.6.2 idea would gain traction :wink:
but I dont want to lose that resource either..i have a feeling convergence will be too unstable for my needs over the next 12 weeks
but, to be fair, that is conjecture on my part
hopefully will become more usable… I’ll go with either approach
